channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: If you love jeopardy as I do you should watch tonight.

I wasn't reading Andrew Sullivan before Trump, so I thought he was a reasonable person. Now I'm reading what he says about abortion and I get why people dislike him so. When they come for his rights, I expect he'll be reasonable again.
Peter Thiel Plans to Wind Down Involvement. (Interesting that he's doing it, more interesting that he's announcing it.) https://t.co/dwgZs7n8rN
At some point journalism is going to figure out that blockchain and web3 is all about pumping carbon into the atmosphere, make an issue of it.
A new Google Cloud team is building services for Web3 developers. https://t.co/CaC4tqihb1
@mims @theelusivefish I see reports quoting people’s tweets all the time.
@mims @theelusivefish i see reporters using sources from twitter regularly. and based on your initial statement which is a made-up fantasy, i'd say you need better sources.
@mims @theelusivefish how could you possibly know.

Next time you're going to tell someone they're tone deaf or something like that pause for a moment and ask yourself how you know. Sometimes applying truth to power means asking yourself questions you don't want to answer.
Carville Says Republicans Don’t Fear Democrats. https://t.co/KtwpbgG1yo

The reason the United States is as fucked up as it is is that we were born with slavery. The Constitution was designed so that American whites could keep making wealth with its slaves, along with the pretense of being about freedom. We're living with that right now.
And the chief justice who says he worries so much as the court seeming legit is also the person who scuttled the Voting Rights Act and gave us unlimited corporate money in our elections, so he should cut the shit about legit, he's just another servant of the super rich.
Our economic prowess belongs to a very few people and they won't share it with the people. That's the top line. They don't give a shit about the unborn, we all know that, it's a way to get stupid white people to vote for their candidates.
As I understand the history they did that with slavery too. The convinced poor southern whites that they were superior to slaves, and they kept voting to maintain that sense of being privileged, even though they got nothing, zip, they were poor white trash.
Someone should book a big auditorium, maybe at Cooper Union, to have @elieNYC speak about the Constitution. It really is all about slavery. We're still fighting about that.

@lifesafeast A country with a Constitution that was designed so that slavers could keep their slaves. And btw, Europeans profited enormously from that system as much as Americans, so they should get down off their high horses. Their ancestors gave us this curse we have to overcome.

One way Twitter can grow is to become a coral reef. And to do that we need the ability to attach data to tweets. @jack understands this. I had lunch with him, in 2007 or 2008, and he said this was the plan. I loved it. Can't wait.
I recognized the idea from the architecture of the Mac, and we used the same idea in Frontier.
In the Mac it's called a refcon. A handle that's up to the application.
We used the same name in Frontier out of respect to the concept we were copying.
"Only steal from the best."
@theelusivefish @mims all good points. and i'd add journalists *should* be here because this is where their sources are.
I want women to be empowered to be equal participants in society in every way.

@mims Twitter grew out of the blogging world and the people of blogs and the norms of blogging moved here. That's why Twitter is what it is. Facebook started with students, then moved to families. That's why it is what it is.
@AdamSinger @mims Yes. Trolls follow crowds online. To say a place has trolls simply means enough people congregate there to attract trolls.
@mims That's not what's going on. I wouldn't know where to begin. There's a reason Twitter is what it is and this ain't it.
@samanthamcgarry I know what you mean. 🤪
@samanthamcgarry What’s the matter?
There’s rage at this Roe v Wade mess – and those on the left who didn’t see it coming. https://t.co/jrAXUVRE4e
AP analysis finds growing number of poor, high-hazard dams. https://t.co/WibswPRfyn
Dear @ziprecruiter -- someone signed my email address up to your service. Please delete the account. Thanks.
